questions.text: What is the action of structure attached to marked area?

A 34-year-old woman is admitted to the hospital after a car collision. Physical examination reveals a mallet finger. Which of the following conditions is expected to be present during radiographic examination?

options.label: A
options.text: A lesion of the ulnar nerve at the distal flexor crease of the wrist

options.label: B
options.text: A separation of the extension expansion over the middle interphalangeal joint

options.label: C
options.text: Compression of the deep ulnar nerve by dislocation of the lunate bone

options.label: D
options.text: Avulsion fracture of the dorsum of the distal phalanx

questions.correct_answer: D. Avulsion fracture of the dorsum of the distal phalanx

questions.text: A 56-year-old woman is admitted to the hospital after a severe car crash. A large portion of her chest wall needed to be surgically removed and replaced with a Musculo-osseous scapular graft involving the medial border of the scapula. Which of the following arteries will most likely recompensate the blood supply to the entire scapula?
Identify the marked muscle

A 48-year-old woman who has had a stroke complains of weakness of her right arm and weakness of her right lower face. Language assessment reveals the following speech deficits: slow, labored speech; dysarthric, telegraphic speech; usually good comprehension; and poor repetition. Which of the following types of aphasia do these neurologic findings describe best?

A patient was examined by the oral surgeon for a lesion on his hard palate and noticed diamond inserts on the labial aspect of the central incisors, signs of oral tobacco use, the presence of a round tongue piercing, and a small fistula that originated in the nasal cavity. When questioned, the patient indicated that the piercing has been in place for almost 10 years but the opening between the oral and nasal cavities occurred only a few weeks ago. What is the most likely cause of the fistula?

options.label: B
options.text: Diamond implants in the central incisors

questions.correct_answer: D. Abuse of drugs by inhalation (snorting)

questions.text: Write the names of Marked structure ?
Match Column A with B
Assertion (A): Deep Peroneal nerve injury leads to foot drop. Reason (R) :Deep Peroneal nerve supplies muscles of posterior compartment of leg.

options.label: A
options.text: Both A and R are true and R is correct explanation of A

options.label: B
options.text: Both A and R are true and R is NOT correct explanation of A

options.label: C
options.text: A is true R is false

options.label: D
options.text: R is true A is false

questions.correct_answer: C. A is true R is false

questions.text: A newborn presents with severe acidosis, vomiting, hypotonia, and neurologic deficits. Laboratory analysis reveals elevated levels of lactate and alanine. These observations suggest a deficiency of which of the following enzymes?

A 26 years old pregnant woman complains of persistent, dry, ulcerated skin over her knees and elbows. Examination of her eyes reveals small, gray plaques on the conjunctiva. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
Which of the following statement is true regarding “Catecholamines” ?

options.label: A
options.text: Production terminates with dopamine in the brain but epinephrine in the adrenal gland

options.label: B
options.text: Production begins with the action of tyrosinase on tyrosine

options.label: C
options.text: Are metabolized to both glucogenic and ketogenic fragments

options.label: D
options.text: All contain methyl group donated by S-adenosyl methionine

questions.correct_answer: A. Production terminates with dopamine in the brain but epinephrine in the adrenal gland

questions.text: Arachidonic Acid is synthesized from?
Fluoroquinolones (ciprofloxacin) act by inhibiting bacterial DNA gyrase. What is the function of DNA gyrase?
questions.correct_answer: B. Relieve torsional strain on DNA

questions.text: Enzyme which is active in well fed state is:
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • Acety1 Co-A carboxylase is the rate- limiting step of fatty acid synthesis. Fatty acid synthesis occurs during well fed state. Insulin is the predominant hormone during well-fed state. Pyruvate carboxylase is the first step during gluconeogenesis. Gluconeogenesis is favored by glucagon, the predominant hormone of the fasting state. Carnitine palmitoyl transferase1 is the regulatory step for fatty acid oxidation, which occurs during fasting.
  • • Acety1 Co-A carboxylase is the rate- limiting step of fatty acid synthesis. Fatty acid synthesis occurs during well fed state. Insulin is the predominant hormone during well-fed state.
  • • Pyruvate carboxylase is the first step during gluconeogenesis. Gluconeogenesis is favored by glucagon, the predominant hormone of the fasting state.
  • • Carnitine palmitoyl transferase1 is the regulatory step for fatty acid oxidation, which occurs during fasting.

Consider following statements regarding cyanide poisoning is a) Only minimally inhibits the ETC because cytochrome oxidase is the terminal component of the chain b) Inhibits mitochondrial respiration but energy production is unaffected c) It results in complete disruption of oxidative phosphorylation d) It stabilizes iron of cytochrome a3 in ferrous form e) It stabilizes iron of cytochrome a3 in ferric form Select the correct option stating all correct statements :

Genetic code follow the rule of degeneracy. It means that there are multiple codons for same amino acids. For example, valine has four codon coding for it. Provided one codon for valine is GUC, the other codons for it may be

McArdle's disease is one of the glycogen storage disorder. Consider following statements in relation to this disease and choose the best option stating correct statements a) It is due to deficiency of glycogen phosphorylase enzyme in liver b) It is due to deficiency of glycogen phosphorylase enzyme in skeletal muscle c) It is due to deficiency of glycogen phosphorylase kinase enzyme in muscle d) Hypoglycemia is characteristic finding e) Lactic acid level in blood is low after exercise

A patient presents to an emergency with history of road traffic accident. An immediate uncross matched blood is being transfused to the patient. A routine peripheral blood examination in this patient is likely to show ?

options.label: A
options.text: Normocytic normochromic RBC with Retic count <3%

options.label: C
options.text: Normocytic normochromic RBC with Retic count >3%

questions.correct_answer: A. Normocytic normochromic RBC with Retic count <3%

questions.text: A 35-year-old lady had a laceration of popliteal artery in a road traffic accident, she underwent surgical repair of the artery and received 8 units of blood transfusion in total. Now she is doing well and is about to be discharged after a week of admission, she develops multiple petechial rashes on her back and dorsum of hands. A blood examination reveals, bleeding time 12 min (control 6 min), PT 14 s (control 15 s), APTT42 s (control 44 s) platelet count of 25,000/cu.mm. which of the following constitutes the best treatment in this patient?

A new born of a healthy mother via normal vaginal delivery has a prolonged Jaundice, he was treated with extended phototherapy sessions. Clinical examination showed mild hepatomegaly thus he was prescribed hepatoprotective and multivitamin tablets and sent home after the jaundice appeared to be under control. Eight months later the infant has high grade fever, cough, tachypnoea, not able to feed. The liver was found further enlarged. Pseudomonas aeruginosa was isolated from respiratory secretions the child was put on antibiotics. Although fever breathlessness subsided after antibiotics the hepatomegaly persisted. An ultrasound revealed no neoplastic or inflammatory lesions. A liver biopsy was performed and a PAS stained image is as shown in the image. Which of the following is pathogenesis responsible the child’s liver findings?

A 25-year-old male underwent a colonoscopy for bleeding per rectum. Six polyps from the mucosa were seen in the colon approximately 10 mm in diameter, however none of them had a definitive stalk. A polypectomy procedure was performed. The patient’s mother was diagnosed of endometrial cancer. You are suspecting an inherited cancer syndrome. Which of the following will make you more certain of the cancer syndrome you are suspecting in this patient?

options.label: C
options.text: A sessile serrated adenoma on histology

questions.correct_answer: C. A sessile serrated adenoma on histology

questions.text: A young medico is being posted to tribal villages of Chhattisgarh. As prophylaxis for malaria he starts antimalarial drugs. 3 days after the drug he complains of increasing fatigue. The early morning urine sample is dark coloured. A CBC showed a Hb of 8 g/dL, the peripheral blood examination is as shows in the image. True about this disease is? i. It is mostly autosomal recessive in inheritance ii. It is a drug induced Auto immune haemolytic anemia iii. Urine examination is likely to show RBC but no casts iv. enzyme deficiency leads to such manifestation v. Eculizumab is used in treatment
Match the following translocation with their corresponding malignancies

A 55-year has with weight loss of 8 kg over last four weeks, cough and sputum production. He does not feel hungry and feels lethargic to get out of the bed. He has been having few bouts of vomiting for last two days for which ORS has been adequately given. Now he brought to emergency room because he has memory loss, he is confused. He has been a chronic smoker for last 20 years with history of 20-30 per day. A blood examination shows blood glucose 140mg/dL, serum sodium of 119 mmol/L rest others within normal limits. A chest CT shows a small 1 cm nodule in the lung and a biopsy was done and is as shown in the image. Which of the following is true about this case?

options.label: A
options.text: The tumor arises from Type II pneumocytes

options.label: B
options.text: Metastasis to brain leads to reduced secretion of ADH

options.label: C
options.text: There is excess secretion of ADH by tumor cells

options.label: D
options.text: Tumor cells are negative for chromogranin

questions.correct_answer: C. There is excess secretion of ADH by tumor cells

questions.text: A young & proud medical graduate like you is asked to draw sample of blood on the first day of his internship. He ties the tourniquet on the left arm of the patient and tries to locate th vein in the antecubital fossa after 3 minutes of tightening the tourniquet he finally found the vein. While drawing the blood he is unable to draw it directly into vacuum tube thus he decides to draw the blood in 5 ml syringe and transfer to the vacutainer subsequently. While transferring blood to red tube he observes the serum starts appearing red. Which of the following abnormalities if found in this patient should be disregarded due to consequence of faulty phlebotomy technique? i. Elevated total protein ii. Elevated blood sugar iii. Elevated potassium iv. Elevated sodium v. Elevated chloride

A 26-year-old woman has had menorrhagia since menarche. On physical examination she has no abnormal findings. Laboratory studies show Hgb 11.3 g/dL, Hct 33.6%, MCV 73 fL, platelet count 231,700/microliter, and WBC count 5690/microliter. Her prothrombin time is 13 seconds (control 14 S) and partial thromboplastin time 47 seconds(control 42 S). Her bleeding time is 12 minutes (control 5 min). Which of the following blood products is most likely to be useful in treating bleeding complications in this woman?

A 22-year-old boy presents with passing of passing blood in urine. He does not have pain in flank or during micturition, but he has a throat pain with itching sensation for last 2 days. Urine examination shows RBC casts and numerous RBC. Renal biopsy is as shows in the image. Which of the following is true about the disease? i. It is an immune complex disease ii. Immunofluorescence will show starry sky pattern. iii. Electron microscopy shows deposits in mesangium iv. The disease is non recurrent v. Aberrantly glycosylated Immunoglobulin A is responsible for the disease.
questions.correct_answer: A. I, III, v are true

questions.text: True about mechanisms of tumor cells escaping from host immunity is i. Selective growth of antigen negative clones ii. Reduced expression of MHC class I molecules in tumor cells iii. Inhibition of CTLA 4 on tumor specific T cells iv. Expression of PD-1 on T cells v. Activation of regulatory T cells (T Reg)

A 57-year man presents with sudden onset of severe chest pain radiating to back and breathless ness to the emergency room. An ECG shows no abnormalities, cardiac enzymes were normal. An imaging shows the aortic arch is dilated. Further history this patient had a painless ulcer on his penis 9 months ago which healed on its own without any medical intervention. Which of the following are true about this patient’s disease? I. The patient is likely to have an aortic aneurysm. II. The patient is likely to show elevated ASLO titre III. He is likely to be positive for HIV IV. Obliterative end arteritis is the pathogenesis in this case V. The disease is caused by a spirochete bacteria.

A 47-year-old woman undergoes routine mammographic screening and there are multiple small areas of increased density, though a single distinctive mass lesion is not detectable either by palpation or by mammography. A fine needle aspiration biopsy of an abnormal density reveals cells suspicious for a malignancy. An excisionalbreast biopsy shows few hyperchromatic cells arranged in a single Indian file pattern. Which of the following is the most likely finding associated with this woman's carcinoma?

A 45-year-old woman has had a chronic, non-productive cough for 3 months, along with intermittent fever. She has a chest radiograph that reveals multiple small parenchymal nodules along with hilar and cervical lymphadenopathy. A cervical lymph node biopsy is performed. Microscopic examination of the biopsy shows noncaseating granulomatous inflammation. Cultures for bacterial, fungal, and mycobacterial organisms are negative. Which of the following chemical mediators is most important in the development of her inflammatory response?

A 45-year-old man, who is a known case of rheumatic heart disease underwent a root-canal treatment for carried tooth, three days later he presents with high grade fever headache and weakness in the right hand. Auscultation shows a new murmur in the mitral area. Blood examination shows a TLC of 15,000/cu.mm, DLC showed a neutrophilia. A CT brain showed an irregular lesion with enhancing walls. Which of the following cellular mechanisms is leading to such a CNS lesion

options.label: A
options.text: An infarct with maintained Outlines of the tissue

options.label: B
options.text: A liquefactive necrosis with loss of tissue outlines

options.label: C
options.text: An infarct with loss of tissue outlines

options.label: D
options.text: A cheese like material in the necrotic tissue

questions.correct_answer: B. A liquefactive necrosis with loss of tissue outlines

questions.text: A 31-year-old man with AIDS was recently diagnosed with cytomegalovirus pneumonia. The patient’s current medica- tions included zidovudine, didanosine, and atazanavir. In- travenous therapy with ganciclovir was started. Which of the following adverse effects would be predicted to be most likely to occur due to the concurrent administration of gan- ciclovir and the antiretroviral drugs?
Match the following antihyperlipidemic drugs with their respective categories A to E:
Match the following categories of laxatives/purgati es with their respective examples A to E:
Drug of choice for Actinomycosis is
If the plasma concentration of a drug declines with “first-order kinetics”, this means that

options.label: A
options.text: There is only one metabolic path for drug disposition

options.label: B
options.text: The half-life is the same regardless of the plasma concentration

options.label: C
options.text: The drug is largely metabolized in the liver after oral administration and has low bioavailability elimination

options.label: D
options.text: The rate of elimination is proportionate to the rate of administration at all times

options.label: E
options.text: The drug is not distributed outside the vascular system

questions.correct_answer: B. The half-life is the same regardless of the plasma concentration

questions.text: Methylxanthines exert the following action (s) at cellular/molecular level
questions.correct_answer: B. Antagonism of adenosine A1 receptor

questions.text: Extended matching

A 75-year-old woman on hydrochlorothiazide, raloxifene for her hypertension and for osteoporosis, had a stroke approximately1 month ago. She is continuing to have small focal seizures where she fails to respondappropriately while talking. Which is the most appropriate treatment for this individual?

Find out the true and false statements regarding opioids A. Morphine is the best choice for severe pain secondary to a compression fracture in the lumbar spine in patients with renal insufficiency B. Buprenorphine has a lower number of drug–drug interactions compared to methadone C. The duration of analgesia for methadone is much shorter than the limination half-life. D. Opioid-induced constipation is only seen with the initiation of opioid therapy.

Find out the incorrect statements A. Dihydropyridine CCB should be avoided for treating angina with heart failure B. Beta blockers with ISA is preferred for treating angina C. Iso sarbide mono nitrate should not take with PDE5 inhibitors D. St john’s wort will increase the risk of QT prolongation of ranolazine

A 72-year-old man with hyperlipidemia and renal insufficiency has been treated with high-intensity atorvastatin for 6 months. His LDL-C is 131 mg/dL; triglycerides, 710 mg/dL; and HDL-C, 32 mg/dL. His physician wishes to add another agent for hyperlipidemia. Which is the best option to address the hyperlipidemia in this patient?

A 56-year-old man presents to the emergency room with complaints of swelling, redness, and pain in his right leg. The patient is diagnosed with acute DVT, Which drug is most appropriate drug used orally for treatment of DVT in this patient?

To control and prevent COVID19 pandemic, Vaccines plays a major role. Different types of vaccines available with different mechanisms of action. Choose the correct answer from the given Choices. 1. Covishield – Adenovirus recombinant vaccine 2. Covaxin – Killed vaccine 3. Moderna vaccine – mRNA vaccine 4. Sputnik V – Live attenuated vaccine

A 23-year-old man working in schistosome-endemic areas was exposed to massive initial doses of cercariae before any protective immunity existed. In these individual, IgG antibodies developed in response to the developing worms, and when the adults began their prodigious release of eggs into the circulation, this patient suffered acute and potentially life-threatening symptoms of fever, edema, arthralgia, and rash. Which of the following is another condition that arises by a similar immunologic mechanism?

A 65-year-old man is admitted in emergency room because of recent aggravation of an exfoliative skin condition that has plagued him for several years. He had been receiving a variety of topical antibiotic regimens over the last two years. He now has a temperature of 38.9 C . The skin of upper chest, extremities, and neck shows erythema with diffuse epidermal peeling and many pustular lesions. Cultures obtained from these lesions were reported back from the laboratory as yielding a gram-positive organism that is highly salt tolerant. Culture in Ludlam medium shown in the image. What lab result is used to confirm the species of the causal agent?

A 38-year-old man is undergoing treatment for acute myeloid leukemia.Suddenly he developed fever, sore throat and diarrhea. His physician ordered COVID19 RT-PCR which turned to be positive. His PaO2 was 88. Admitted in ICU and management with Oxygen and antivirals, he recovered after a week of admission. Now he has noted increasingly severe right sided headaches. He describes the pain to be throbbing in nature and located behind his right eye. He also has associated nasal stuffiness. The patient has no prior history of allergies. Physical examination reveals right-sided proptosis and periorbital tenderness. Biopsy of the right maxillary sinus mucosa reveals the pathogen as shown in the image. Which of the following is the most likely cause of this patient's condition?

A 27-year-old man comes to the OPD due to a 2-week history of genital papules that are not painful or pruritic. Over this period, he has also had fatigue and mild, generalized arthralgia but no urethral discharge or dysuria. The patient had gonococcal urethritis 3 months ago, which was adequately treated, and tests fix for other sexually transmitted infections at that time were negative. He is sexually active with several male and female partners and reports using condoms consistently after the episode of gonorrhea. Temperature is 37.6 C. Physical examination shows a faint, diffuse maculopapular skin rash involving the trunk, extremities, palms, and soles. There are several enlarged, nontender inguinal lymph nodes. Genital examination reveals multiple elevated lesions on the scrotum and perineal region. Histopathologic evaluation of these lesions would most likely reveal which of the following in this patient?

options.label: A
options.text: Acantholysis with superficial dermal lymphocytic infiltrate

options.label: B
options.text: Dysplastic spindle cells with viral genome that form vascular channels

options.label: C
options.text: Intense plasma cell—rich infiltrate With proliferative endarteritis

options.label: D
options.text: Panniculitis and septal inflammation with multinucleated giant cells

questions.correct_answer: C. Intense plasma cell—rich infiltrate With proliferative endarteritis

questions.text: Choose the correct statement(s) regarding the life cycle 1. Cow is its intermediate host 2. Human is its definitive host 3. Its infection can cause vitamin B12 4. Its larval stage is not found in human 5. Its egg cannot be differentiated from that of Taenia saginata

A 32-year-old woman comes to the casuality due to 6 days of fatigue and intermittent fever. Medical history is significant for depression. She does not use tobacco, alcohol, or illicit drugs and has no drug allergies. Her blood microscopy findings are shown in the image. Urine pregnancy test is negative. Statements regarding her condition is given below. Choose the correct choice about her disease. 1. Causes relapse after a primary infection. 2. Causes malignant tertian malaria. 3. Has a band-shaped trophozoite. 4. Causes knobs to be formed on the infected red blood cells. 5. Has crescent-shaped schizonts.

A 35 year old woman presented shocked with a one week history of sore throat and fever. Her blood pressure was 80 mmHg systolic, temperature 39.5C and pulse 130. She was mildly jaundiced and had a macular erythematous rash that blanched on pressure. She was oliguric and had biochemical evidence of renal failure. Her creatine kinase was twice the upper limit of normal. A list of differential diagnosis given below. Choose the appropriate choice. 1. Myocardial infarction 2. Meningococcal septicemia , 3. Leptospirosis, 4. Toxic shock syndrome, 5. Rocky Mountain spotted fever

A 27-year-old man comes to the emergency department due to 2 weeks of low-grade fever, malaise, and loss of appetite. The patient has no prior medical conditions and takes no medications. He does not smoke cigarettes or drink alcohol but regularly injects illicit drugs. The patient is sexually active and uses condoms inconsistently. Physical examination reveals scleral icterus. A smooth and mildly tender liver edge is palpable 4 cm below the right costal margin. Which of the following is an essential step in the replication cycle of the vims infecting this patient?

options.label: B
options.text: Integration of Viral DNA into the host genome

options.label: C
options.text: Release of new viral particles by host cell lysis

options.label: D
options.text: Reverse transcription of template RNA to viral DNA

questions.correct_answer: D. Reverse transcription of template RNA to viral DNA

One month after vaccination, the levels of which of the following poliovirus antibodies will differ the most between these 2 patients?

A 25-year-old gravida 5, para 4, woman rapidly delivered an infant weighing 3,900 g . After an hour, the placenta was manually extracted. A total of 20 U of oxytocin in 1,000 mL of lactated Ringer’s solution was initiated intravenously. After careful inspection of the genital tract, no laceration was noted on the vaginal wall and the cervix. You are called back to the room 30 minutes later by the nurse to evaluate increase vaginal bleeding from the patient. You begin massaging the uterine fundus but her bleeding continues. Her fundus appears to be fi rm, after you have given her a dose of 0.25 mg IM Prostaglandin F 2. Her blood pressure is 164/92, P is 102,. The patient continues to experience intermittent vaginal bleeding. Which of the following is the best step in management?

options.label: C

questions.text: The neonatology team attends the delivery of an infant born at 41 weeks’ gestation because of a nonreassuring fetal heart rate and meconium-stained amniotic fluid. questions.text: A term infant is delivered vaginally and has an Apgar score of 8 and 8 at 1 and 5 minutes, respectively. At approximately 15 minutes of life, the infant develops respiratory distress evident by grunting, flaring and retractions. Pulse oximetry in the right arm reveals an oxygen saturation of 50% the infant is placed in a 100% oxygen hood and O2 saturations improve to 65%. The infant is intubated and O2 saturations remain at 65% Echocardiography reveals total anomalous pulmonary veins that appear to be obstructive. The medical student rotating in the NICU asks the neonatologist to explain the most likely pathway of this infant’s pulmonary veins. A pediatrician receives a phone call from the state’s newborn screening program regarding a 7-day old neonate with an elevated trypsinogen, which is concerning for a diagnosis of cystic fibrosis. The neonate was seen by the pediatrician’s partner 1 day ago and had appropriate feeding and growth parameters as well as normal vital signs and physical examination findings. The partner noted that there is no significant family history of diseases in childhood. Of the following the MOST appropriate next step is to

options.label: A
options.text: Inform the parents of the diagnosis of cystic fibrosis

options.label: B
options.text: Discuss the result at the 2-month health supervision visit

options.label: C

options.label: D
options.text: Schedule the neonate for diagnostic testing

questions.correct_answer: D. Schedule the neonate for diagnostic testing

questions.text: An 8-year-old boy is brought to the office for evaluation of nighttime bedwetting. He has never been dry at night and has urinary accidents 5 nights per week. The boy’s parents report that he has been completely continent during the day since 3 years of age. He has no history of urinary frequency, urgency, or hesitancy. He has a normal daily bowel movement and has not had fecal soiling. He is described as a deep sleeper. He is embarrassed to sleep at his cousin’s house. His father also had mighttime bedwetting until he was 9 years old. The boy’s parents decreased his fluid intake before bedtime and tried bedwetting alarms, but with no improvement in the boy’s frequency of nighttime bedwetting. He is at the 50th percentile for weight and height. He has no skin lesions on his back. His abdomen is soft with no organomegaly. His neurological examination findings are normal. A urinalysis performed in the office has normal results. A 48-hour voiding diary shows that the boy voids 4 to 6 times per day with a normal maximum urine volume of 300 ml. If pharmacological therapy is persued, the BEST initial agent is

questions.text: A 59-year-old woman with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease presents to the emergency department after developing the sudden onset of pleuritic left-sided chest pain and dyspnea. questions.text: A 38-year-old man obtains a chest radiograph as part of a preemployment screening program. He undergoes bronchoscopy with transbronchial biopsies, which reveal noncaseating granulomas. Which of the following is true regarding this patient? a. He will likely have an increased arterial PCO2 on arterial blood gas analysis. b. He is not at risk for involvement in any other organ systems. c. Elevated serum ACE levels and lymphopenia can be seen d. Spontaneous remission is commonly seen with this stage of the disease. Select the right combination

options.label: B
options.text: If a and c are correct

options.label: C
options.text: If c and d are correct

options.label: D
options.text: If all four (a, b, c, & d) are correct

questions.correct_answer: C. If c and d are correct

options.label: B
options.text: CT scan of the chest without contrast

questions.text: True regarding following chest xray : A. Normal chest wall expansion on diseased side B. Stony dullness on percussion C. Coarse Crepitations heard on auscultation D. Air bronchogram is not the classical radiological finding. Select the right combination

options.label: A
options.text: If A, B, C are correct

options.label: B
options.text: If A and C are correct

options.label: C
options.text: If B and D are correct

options.label: D
options.text: If all four (A, B, C, & D) are correct

questions.correct_answer: C. If B and D are correct

questions.text: A 45/M had COVID pneumonia with spo2 85 % & had to be intubated for respiratory failure. His Neutrophil / Lymphocyte ratio is 7, CRP is 80 ug /mL , ferritin 1000ng /ml & Ddimer : 0.4 ug/ml. The ventilator settings are assist control with tidal volume 500 mL and frequency 15 /min. She weighs 60 kg. His chest xray is given below . True regarding management is :

options.label: A
options.text: Avoid sedation and neuromuscular blockade as pt is in respiratory failure

options.label: B
options.text: Prone positioning is not indicated as pt is ventilated

options.label: D
options.text: Decrease ventilator frequency to 10 breaths per min

questions.correct_answer: C. Decrease tidal volume to 360 mL.

questions.text: A 68-year-old man , known smoker and diabetic diabetic is brought into the emergency department with tachypnea , fatiguability & fever. On examination pt is conscious and looks dehydrated. An arterial blood gas shows pH 7.25, PaCO2 22, PaO2 62, and H CO 3− 10. Which of the following could account for the observed abnormalities on his blood gases?
Match the drugs used in the management of heart failure with their mechanism of action :
On auscultation, a patient is found to have splitting of the second heart sound which increases during expiration. Which ONE of the following disorders does not cause this phenomenon?

A 34-year-old woman is on anti-arrhythmic drugs. She develops a fungal infection and is prescribed Terbinafine for the same. The patient develops sudden palpitation with shock and is brought to the emergency department. The following ECG is recorded. Which of following drugs may be responsible for this condition EXCEPT:
Which of the following viral infections is associated with highest risk of progression to fulminant disease & acute liver failure:

A 78-year-old confused man presents to hospital after not passing stool for 3 days. A careful history from his daughter reveals he has lost 8kg in weight over the past 2 months and has been acting unusually over the past month or so. Which of the following tumour markers would be expected to be raised in this disease?

A 43-year-old man complains of fatigue,headache, anorexia, and a dull ache in the left upper quadrant of his abdomen. Examination reveals a mass extending just below the left costal margin; the mass is presumed to be an enlarged spleen. Which of the following would not be a possible cause of this man’s illness?
